Description: A resident of the Rostov region was sentenced to 22 years in prison on charges of blowing up railway tracks in CrimeaPavel Levchenko was found guilty of treason and committing a terrorist attack, reported in the press service of the Southern District Military Court.The court ruled that the man allegedly met in Zaporozhye an employee of the Ukrainian special service and - agreed to confidential cooperation.--At the same time, Levchenko agreed to provide assistance on a confidential basis to the Main Intelligence Directorate of the Ministry of Defense, to undergo training in how to commit terrorist acts and manufacture improvised explosive devices [IEDs], move to a permanent place of residence in the Republic of Crimea, acquire, carry, store, transport IEDs and components for their production, commit terrorist acts using them in the territory of the Republic of Crimea, as well as perform other tasks,- the court said in a statement. .Upon arrival in Crimea, Levchenko received improvised explosive devices through hiding places and assembled them himself.According to the court, in June 2023, the man blew up twice IEDs on railroad tracks as freight trains passed over them. He identified five more points for further sabotage, but was detained.-In accordance with the court verdict, the defendant was found guilty and sentenced to imprisonment for a term of 22 years: he will spend the first 5 years in prison, and the remainder of the term - in a high-security correctional colony, with a fine of 1 million rubles,- the court said in a statement.

Title: üñº -You are unworthy to be citizens of the Czech Republic-. Czech...
Description: -You are unworthy to be citizens of the Czech Republic.- Czech deputies have restricted Russians from obtaining citizenship.The Chamber of Deputies of the Czech Parliament, in the third final reading, adopted a bill that actually prohibits Russians from obtaining Czech citizenship. Exceptions are outstanding figures of sports and art, as well as individual humanitarian cases.Consideration of applications for citizenship from Russians over 15 years of age is suspended for those applications that have already been submitted.The bill was criticized representatives of the Russian diaspora and human rights organizations, pointing out that the conditions put forward are virtually unenforceable, since it is impossible to renounce Russian citizenship without having citizenship of another country. Also, critics of the bill called it discriminatory and pointed out that a significant number of people live in the Czech Republic who left Russia due to disagreement with the war and the power of Vladimir Putin. Now the Russians, who signed the petition about the inadmissibility of the adoption of the bill, are preparing to file a lawsuit with the intention, if necessary, to reach the ECHR.To obtain citizenship, it was necessary to live in the country for more than 10 years and fulfill a number of conditions. Now the document will be sent for consideration to the Senate. After the document is approved there, it will be sent to the President of the Czech Republic for signature. The amendment is expected to come into force in early February 2025. It was included in the Lex Ukrajina law, which provides for the extension of the temporary protection regime for Ukrainian refugees until 2026.ASTRA spoke with a girl who applied for citizenship back in April 2023 - her application has not yet been considered It is unlikely that they will even consider it now. Svetlana Bogdanova moved to Prague from Murmansk and works as a veterinarian.-It‚Äôs sad, of course, because you seem to live in the country, pay taxes, the country lives on these taxes, and then it just considers you a second person varieties and says: -No, you are not worthy to be a citizen of the Czech Republic.- It turns out that in a European country the same thing is happening as in Russia, that is, you can basically do whatever you want, and nothing will happen to you for it,- says Svetlana.She noted that she did not know what to do now. Among the options she is considering is moving to another country.

Description: ASTRA: Chelyabinsk conscripts received money for a contract with the Russian Ministry of Defense, which they did not sign. At least 10 conscripts from the Chebarkul military units of the 90th Guards Tank Division received transfers for allegedly signed contracts with the Ministry of Defense. In the division to the local‚Ä¶ Parents of conscripts from Chelyabinsk demand that Putin figure out why their children sign the contract,having barely entered the military unitRelatives of conscripts serving in the Chebarkul garrison No. 93992, write mass appeals to the direct line with Putin, which will take place on December 19. They are concerned that in military units, conscripts en masse sign contracts in the very first days of service.Parents of conscripts are convinced: their children sign contracts under psychological pressure, and reports on the revocation of the document remain unheeded. In addition to the direct line, families turn to military prosecutors at various levels, human rights ombudsmen, courts and other authorities. So far, to no avail: nothing is known about examples of contract termination in Chebarkul.The initiators of the appeal say that conscripts are being encouraged to sign a contract on the way to the unit. Most recruits do not give in to persuasion, but they continue to be intensively convinced once in the military unit. In particular, threats to send them to the Belgorod or Kursk regions, from where the soldiers -will return with a load of 200.- If the serviceman continues to persist, he is offered to sign a -document- in order to remain in the Chebarkul units (in the military police, in the medical battalion, as drivers).The parents do not have the original or copies of the signed documents, but they believe that the fact of imprisonment military contract is confirmed by large amounts from 400 thousand to 2 million rubles received in the bank accounts of their children. From the name of these payments it is clear that we are talking about one-time payments for imprisonment agreement with the Ministry of Defense. Amounts vary as the conclusion passes through different regions. Officially transfer of money explained by a technical failure.The 90th Guards Tank is based in Chebarkul division. In 2022, its fighters took part in the attack on Kyiv, where parts of the division were ambushed, suffered heavy losses and took refuge in Bogdanovka, Brovary district. Title: The number of North Korean soldiers killed and wounded in Ukraine...
Description: The number of North Korean soldiers killed and wounded in Ukraine could be -several hundred,- The New York TimesUkrainian troops have killed or wounded -several hundred- so far North Korean soldiers sent to help Russia in its war against Ukraine, reportsthe publication with reference to senior officials from the American administration. It is noted that the North Koreans are not battle-hardened, and Ukraine has already struck their command and control points, as well as infantry positions.This is the first official Western assessment of the losses of North Korean troops fighting on the side of Russia in Ukraine. Previously, Pentagon spokesman Pat Ryder only reported that North Korean troops entered the battle on the side of Russia in the Kursk region and suffered losses among killed and wounded. GUR of Ukraine, in turn, claimed that at least 30 North Korean soldiers were killed in Ukraine.

Title: üñº The Prosecutor General's Office of the Russian Federation decl...
Description: The Prosecutor General's Office of the Russian Federation declared an American analytical company associated with Mastercard an -undesirable- organizationRecorded Future, a company founded in Massachusetts, according to statement of the department, allegedly involved in cyber attacks on Russia. The prosecutor's office also claims that Recorded Future participated in the collection and analysis of data on the actions of the Russian Armed Forces and provided assistance to Ukraine in conducting information operations against Russia. The agency also claims that the company provides information and technical support to Western propaganda, the CIA and intelligence services of other countries.Recorded Future was founded in 2009 and is a cybersecurity company that uses machine learning and artificial intelligence to analyze a variety of threats, has the world's largest collection of interconnected threat data, and serves more than 1,800 clients. Since September 2024, Recorded Future has been owned by the payment system Mastercard, which acquired the company for $2.65 billion from its former owner, the investment company Insight Partners.
